items.name: func makeAsyncIterator() -> Transaction.Transactions.AsyncIterator
items.desc: Creates the asynchronous iterator that produces elements of this asynchronous sequence.

items.name: struct Transaction.Transactions.AsyncIterator
items.desc: The asynchronous iterator that produces elements of the asynchronous sequence.

items.name: typealias Transaction.Transactions.Element
items.desc: The type of element traversed by the iterator.

items.name: func allSatisfy((VerificationResult<Transaction>) -> Bool) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether all elements produced by the asynchronous sequence satisfies the given predicate.

items.name: func contains(VerificationResult<Transaction>) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the asynchronous sequence contains the given element.

items.name: func contains(where: (VerificationResult<Transaction>) -> Bool) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the asynchronous sequence contains an element that satisfies the given predicate.

items.name: func first(where: (VerificationResult<Transaction>) -> Bool) -> VerificationResult<Transaction>?
items.desc: Returns the first element of the sequence that satisfies the given predicate.

items.name: func max(by: (VerificationResult<Transaction>, VerificationResult<Transaction>) -> Bool) -> VerificationResult<Transaction>?
items.desc: Returns the maximum element in the asynchronous sequence, using the given predicate as the comparison between elements.

items.name: func min(by: (VerificationResult<Transaction>, VerificationResult<Transaction>) -> Bool) -> VerificationResult<Transaction>?
items.desc: Returns the minimum element in the asynchronous sequence, using the given predicate as the comparison between elements.

items.name: func prefix(Int) -> AsyncPrefixSequence<Transaction.Transactions>
items.desc: Returns an asynchronous sequence, up to the specified maximum length, containing the initial elements of the base asynchronous sequence.

items.name: func prefix(while: (VerificationResult<Transaction>) -> Bool) -> AsyncPrefixWhileSequence<Transaction.Transactions>
items.desc: Returns an asynchronous sequence, containing the initial, consecutive elements of the base sequence that satisfy the given predicate.

items.name: func drop(while: (VerificationResult<Transaction>) -> Bool) -> AsyncDropWhileSequence<Transaction.Transactions>
items.desc: Omits elements from the base asynchronous sequence until a given closure returns false, after which it passes through all remaining elements.

items.name: func dropFirst(Int) -> AsyncDropFirstSequence<Transaction.Transactions>
items.desc: Omits a specified number of elements from the base asynchronous sequence, then passes through all remaining elements.

items.name: func filter((VerificationResult<Transaction>) -> Bool) -> AsyncFilterSequence<Transaction.Transactions>
items.desc: Creates an asynchronous sequence that contains, in order, the elements of the base sequence that satisfy the given predicate.

items.name: func compactMap<ElementOfResult>((VerificationResult<Transaction>) -> ElementOfResult?) -> AsyncThrowingCompactMapSequence<Transaction.Transactions, ElementOfResult>
items.desc: Creates an asynchronous sequence that maps an error-throwing closure over the base sequence’s elements, omitting results that don’t return a value.

items.name: func compactMap<ElementOfResult>((VerificationResult<Transaction>) -> ElementOfResult?) -> AsyncCompactMapSequence<Transaction.Transactions, ElementOfResult>
items.desc: Creates an asynchronous sequence that maps the given closure over the asynchronous sequence’s elements, omitting results that don’t return a value.

items.name: func flatMap<SegmentOfResult>((VerificationResult<Transaction>) -> SegmentOfResult) -> AsyncThrowingFlatMapSequence<Transaction.Transactions, SegmentOfResult>
items.desc: Creates an asynchronous sequence that concatenates the results of calling the given error-throwing transformation with each element of this sequence.

items.name: func flatMap<SegmentOfResult>((VerificationResult<Transaction>) -> SegmentOfResult) -> AsyncFlatMapSequence<Transaction.Transactions, SegmentOfResult>
items.desc: Creates an asynchronous sequence that concatenates the results of calling the given transformation with each element of this sequence.

items.name: func map<Transformed>((VerificationResult<Transaction>) -> Transformed) -> AsyncThrowingMapSequence<Transaction.Transactions, Transformed>
items.desc: Creates an asynchronous sequence that maps the given error-throwing closure over the asynchronous sequence’s elements.

items.name: func map<Transformed>((VerificationResult<Transaction>) -> Transformed) -> AsyncMapSequence<Transaction.Transactions, Transformed>
items.desc: Creates an asynchronous sequence that maps the given closure over the asynchronous sequence’s elements.

items.name: func reduce<Result>(Result, (Result, VerificationResult<Transaction>) -> Result) -> Result
items.desc: Returns the result of combining the elements of the asynchronous sequence using the given closure.

items.name: func reduce<Result>(into: Result, (inout Result, VerificationResult<Transaction>) -> Void) -> Result
items.desc: Returns the result of combining the elements of the asynchronous sequence using the given closure, given a mutable initial value.
